grammars

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        protected Rule(java.lang.CharSequence regexStr)
        Builds a new Rule with the given CharSequence as the regex.
        Parameters:
        regexStr - String that will be used as a regex for this rule's validation purposes.

      • Rule

        @SafeVarargs
public Rule(java.lang.CharSequence regexStr,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         java.util.AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... replacePairs)
        The most commonly used Rule constructor. If any replacementPairs are given, constructs a HashMap containing them for use in the replace function.
        Parameters:
        regexStr - String that will be used as a regex for this rule's validation purposes.
        id - A human-readable ID for use in the toString.
        replacePairs - An optional list of replacement key-value pairs that are relevant to this rule and must be made for Java correctness, with the key being the Judo keyword and the value being its Java counterpart. For example, the modulus rules needs to provide a mapping "mod" -> "%".

      • Rule

        public Rule(Rule other,
            java.lang.String newId)
        Copy constructor that basically just takes the other Rule's regex. This is used extensively for making copies of "down rules", Rules whose only purpose is to go down one level.
        Parameters:
        other - The other Rule whose regex to copy.
        newId - The new ID to be used by this new Rule.

    • Method Detail

      • addChildren

        public void addChildren(java.lang.String groupName,
                        java.util.List<Rule> children)
        Adds the given List of Rules as children of the given named capturing group. For example, a left associative Rule for dealing with addition would take the multiplication, division, modulus, and root as it's right side children.
        Parameters:
        groupName - The name of the named capturing group with which to associate the given children.
        children - The list of children.

      • allTrue

        protected boolean allTrue(boolean[] arr)
        Convenience method used in validate and replace.
        Parameters:
        arr - A boolean array
        Returns:
        Whether all elements in arr are true.

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.CharSequence toCheck)
        In some ways, the heart of the grammar. Recursively makes sure that all of this rule's children validate, all the way down to a terminal.
        Parameters:
        toCheck - The expression to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether the given expression is valid.

      • replace

        public java.lang.String replace(java.lang.CharSequence toReplace)
        Makes any replacements in the given expression specified in the replacements member. This function has many similarities to validate(), and with better foresight they probably would have been the same function from the beginning. Most Rules don't have replacements to make because our grammar is largely compatible with Java. Such rules have this.replacements = null, which is why I have to check that. The existence of a non-null replacements instance variable also implies that the Rule's Pattern includes a group called replaceMe which includes the offending symbol, for example mod, which has to be replaced with % for Java.
        Parameters:
        toReplace - The expression to do replacements in
        Returns:
        The expression, with necessary replacements made, or null if this Rule didn't match the expression.

      • replaceGroupName

        protected java.lang.String replaceGroupName(java.lang.String toReplaceIn,
                                            java.lang.String groupName,
                                            java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces the capturing group with name groupName with the string replacement, within the string toReplaceIn. It's assumed that the capturing group does exist and the matcher matches.
        Parameters:
        toReplaceIn - The string to replace in
        groupName - The name of the capturing group to replace
        replacement - What to replace it with
        Returns:
        toReplaceIn, with the replacement in place.

      • isTerminal

        protected boolean isTerminal()
        Returns:
        Whether this Rule is a terminal, i.e. it has no children

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This is specifically here because when debugging in the IntelliJ, it will put the toString() of an object next to it, so this greatly helped with debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A human-readable string that identifies this rule in the grammar. Not the regex.
